intro: Schwantesia scutata, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are basal, linear, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Schwantesia scutata is known for its resilience and is often used in rock gardens due to its low maintenance requirements.
